data.title: Spotlight: Women in mathematics
data.meta_description: Find articles, books, and learning opportunities in mathematics and statistics
data.text:
Below are titles in the McGill Library collection, ordered by publication date. If you prefer to listen to a podcast, I can recommend Lost Women of Science.

General titles

Women of genius in science: Whose frequently overlooked contributions changed the world (2023; ebook)

Fifty years of women in mathematics: Reminiscences, history, and visions for the future of AWM (2022; ebook)

12 Bytes: How we got here where we might go next (2021; ebook)

Hidden figures: The American dream and the untold story of the Black women mathematicians who helped win the space race (2016; ebook)

Rise of the rocket girls: The women who propelled us, from missiles to the moon to Mars (2016; print)

The world of Maria Gaetana Agnesi, mathematician of God (2007; print and ebook)

Change is possible: Stories of women and minorities in mathematics (2005; print)

Women becoming mathematicians: Creating a professional identity in post-World War II America (2000; print)

Nobel Prize women in science: Their lives, struggles, and momentous discoveries (1998; ebook)

Women in mathematics: Scaling the heights (1997; print)

Women in mathematics: The addition of difference (1997; print)

Women in mathematics (1974; print)

Biographies

The legacy of Tatjana Afanassjewa: Philosophical insights from the work of an original physicist and mathematician (2021; ebook)

Sophie Germain: Revolutionary mathematician (2020; ebook)

Equivalence: Elizabeth L. Scott at Berkeley (2017; ebook)

NASA Mathematician Katherine Johnson (2017; ebook)

Iris Runge: A life at the crossroads of mathematics, science, and industry (2012; ebook)

Julia, a life in mathematics (1996; print)

Sofya Kovalevskaya

Remembering Sofya Kovalevskaya (2011; ebook)

Little sparrow: A portrait of Sophia Kovalevsky (1983; print)

Sonia Kovalevsky: Biography and autobiography (1895; ebook)

Ada Lovelace

Ada Lovelace: The making of a computer scientist (2018; print)

The bride of science: Romance, reason, and Byron's daughter (1999; print)

The calculating passion of Ada Byron (1986; print)

Emmy Noether

Emmy Noether: Mathematician extraordinaire (2021; ebook)

Proving it her way: Emmy Noether, a life in mathematics (2020; ebook)

Emmy Noether: The mother of modern algebra (2008; ebook)

Emmy Noether: A tribute to her life and work (1981; print)

Emmy Noether, 1882-1935 (1981; print and ebook)

Mary Somerville

The ascent of Mary Somerville in 19th century society (2017; ebook)

Mary Somerville and the world of science (2014; ebook)

Mary Somerville and the cultivation of science, 1815-1840 (1983; ebook)

Personal recollections, from early life to old age (1874; print and ebook)

MacTutor History of Mathematics Archive: Biographies of over 3000 mathematicians with supporting materials.

Biographies of female mathematicians
